co.janicek.core.math.UUID

type
class
Random universally unique identifier (UUID) generators.

Static Variables

private CHARS : Array<String>

Static Methods

public uuid( length : Int, ?radix : Int, ?seed : Int ) : String

parameters
length the desired number of characters
radix the number of allowable values for each character, clamped to [2,62], default = 62
seed optional PRNG seed
Generate a UUID. EXAMPLES: One argument - returns ID of the specified length >>> uuid(15) // 15 character ID (default base=62) "VcydxgltxrVZSTV" Two arguments - returns ID of the specified length, and radix. (Radix must be <= 62) >>> uuid(8, 2) // 8 character ID (base=2) "01001010" >>> uuid(8, 10) // 8 character ID (base=10) "47473046" >>> uuid(8, 16) // 8 character ID (base=16) "098F4D35"

public uuidCompact( ?seed : Int ) : String

A more compact, but less performant, RFC4122v4 solution:

public uuidFast( ?seed : Int ) : String

A more performant, but slightly bulkier, RFC4122v4 solution. We boost performance by minimizing calls to random()

public uuidRfc4122V4( ?seed : Int ) : String

parameters
seed optional PRNG seed
generate RFC4122, version 4 ID example "92329D39-6F5C-4520-ABFC-AAB64544E172"
